required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cortical Neuroplasticity by Muscle Pain of Pain-induced Plasticity
clinical_study.official_title: Cortical Neuroplasticity by Muscle Pain and Non-invasive Modulation of Pain-induced Plasticity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the sensory-motor cortical excitability response to delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS) on Extensor Carpi Radialis (ECR) muscle during muscle hyperalgesia provoked by nerve growth factor (NGF).

primary_outcome.description: Pain on an 11-point numerical rating scale (0 = no pain, 10 = most intense pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.description: 7-point Likert scale; 0 = 'a complete absence of soreness', 1 = 'a light soreness in the muscle felt only when touched/vague ache', 2 = 'a moderate soreness felt only when touched/a slight persistent ache', '3 = 'a light muscle soreness when lifting or carrying objects', 4 = 'a light muscle soreness, stiffness or weakness when moving the wrist without gripping an object', 5 = 'a moderate muscle soreness, stiffness or weakness when moving the wrist', 6 = 'a severe muscle soreness, stiffness or weakness that limits the ability to move'
The Patient-rated Tennis Elbow Evaluation will be used to assess average pain and disability of the injected arm
Pressure applied to the surface of the skin using a handheld algometer.
Transcranial magnetic stimualtion will be used to evoke motor evoked potentials (MEPs) to the extensor carpi radialis muscle

arm_group.description: Three injections of sterile solutions of recombinant human nerve growth factor (NGF) will be performed in the right extensor carpi radialis muscle to induce muscle hyperalgesia.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nerve growth factor group + delayed onset muscle soreness
arm_group.description: Injections of nerve growth factor and eccentric exercise of the extensor carpi radialis muscle will be performed to induce muscle hyperalgesia.

intervention.intervention_name: Sterile solutions of recombinant human nerve growth factor (NGF)
intervention.description: The intramuscular injections of NGF cause muscle soreness.
intervention.arm_group_label: Nerve growth factor group + delayed onset muscle soreness

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men and women
- Speak and understand English.
Exclusion Criteria:Pregnancy
- Drug addiction defined as the use of cannabis, opioids or other drugs
- Previous neurologic, musculoskeletal or mental illnesses
- Lack of ability to cooperate
- History of chronic pain or current acute pain
- Previous experience with rTMS
- Contraindications to rTMS application (history of epilepsy, metal in the head or jaw etc.).
- Failure to pass the "TASS questionnaire" (TASS = Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation Adult Safety Screen)
